description: Enterprise techniques used by NKAbuse, ATT&CK software S1107 (v1.0)
name: NKAbuse (S1107)

techniques.comment: [NKAbuse](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1107) is initially installed and executed through an initial shell script.(Citation: NKAbuse SL)
[NKAbuse](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1107) enables multiple types of network denial of service capabilities across several protocols post-installation.(Citation: NKAbuse SL)
[NKAbuse](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1107) will check victim systems to ensure only one copy of the malware is running.(Citation: NKAbuse SL)
[NKAbuse](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1107) has abused the NKN public blockchain protocol for its C2 communications.(Citation: NKAbuse BC)(Citation: NKAbuse SL)
[NKAbuse](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1107) uses a Cron job to establish persistence when infecting Linux hosts.(Citation: NKAbuse SL)
[NKAbuse](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1107) can take screenshots of the victim machine.(Citation: NKAbuse SL)

[NKAbuse](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1107) conducts multiple system checks and includes these in subsequent "heartbeat" messages to the malware's command and control server.(Citation: NKAbuse SL)
[NKAbuse](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1107) utilizes external services such as ifconfig.me to identify the victim machine's IP address.(Citation: NKAbuse SL)
